query: Plot point A, which has coordinates negative two and one, and its image A-prime, which is the result of reflecting A across the x-axis.
The task is to find the image C prime of point C with coordinates -2 and 9 under a reflection over the line y equals 1 minus x. After finding C prime, plot both C prime and C on a graph.
Plot the rectangle with coordinates negative three, three; five, three; five, negative three; negative three, negative three and its reflection over the line y equals x minus five.
Quadrilateral EFGH has coordinates negative one six three eight two two negative two three. Apply a translation moving EFGH to the left six units and down ten units. Plot EFGH and its image.
Figure P has coordinates negative two, negative two, negative three, negative seven, negative six, negative two. Rotate P counterclockwise about the origin by 90 degrees. Plot P and its image.
Plot point P with coordinates three, five and its image obtained by rotating it clockwise by ninety degrees about the origin.
Dilate point D about the origin with a scale factor of three. Point D has coordinates negative two, zero. Please plot point D and its image.
Dilate point A, which has coordinates ten, eleven, about point P, which has coordinates twelve, twelve, by a scale factor of three. Please plot point A, the image of A after dilation, and point P.
Triangle ABC has coordinates fourteen, one, two, nine, six, thirteen. Dilate ABC about center ten, five by a scale factor of one fourth. Plot ABC, the image of ABC, and the center of dilation.
